The claim is made by Rep: Lloyd Doggett, a Democratic member of Congress from Austin, who stated that Democrats won over a million votes more than Republicans in the last election.
Doggett: s claim is supported by a report from NBC News, which stated that Democrats nationally received 1.1 million more votes than Republicans in the 2012 House races.
The Cook Political Report: a nonpartisan publication, conducted an analysis that confirmed Democrats outpolled Republicans by 1.37 million votes in the 2012 House races.
While redistricting and gerrymandering w: some political scientists argue that other factors, such as the concentration of Democratic votes in urban areas, also contributed to the Republican majority in the House.
